common_issues.title: Pieces macOS App and Raycast Extension Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the Pieces macOS app and its Raycast extension. The app update process gets stuck in a loop, and the extension is incompatible with recent Raycast versions, displaying error messages.  This suggests potential bugs in the update mechanism and version compatibility checks.  Users should try reinstalling the app and extension or check for manual update options.

related_issues.title: Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast
related_issues.text:
Raycast Extension Incompatible with Current Version of Raycast


### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Raycast Extension

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

As mentioned on Discord, it appears that the Raycast needs to be updated to be compatible with (at least) the current version of Raycast 1.100.3. Trying to use any of the extension's functions triggers an error saying:

> Your Pieces Raycast Extension needs to be updated,...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/506778e6-5b13-4811-a21c-82c42384cb41)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop (MacOS) won't update
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop (MacOS) won't update
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.1.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

If I start Pieces Desktop, it tells me it's out of date.

When I click on "check for Desktop App updates" the loader loads to about 40% on the icon and then restarts the app and I get the exact same message.
So it seems your updater is stuck in a loop.


Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App on macOS update issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing problems updating the Pieces desktop app on macOS.  Symptoms include the app reporting it's out of date, update checks failing or looping, and workstream activities not updating.  This affects various Pieces OS versions.  Check for existing reported issues and ensure a stable internet connection. Further troubleshooting may be required.

related_issues.title: Workstream activity can't update last week tasks
related_issues.text:
Workstream activity can't update last week tasks
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I opened #753.
Now, Today's workstream is being updated but still I can't update last week activities with refresh button(select last week)

Is it good to think I can't revive last week tasks or I will be fixed?

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e177dccd-caea-46b9-bdbb-d3f4e88bfc84)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/91b7556d-d795-4e3d-8396-3b81cda2770d)

common_issues.title: Authentication error on new Pieces install
common_issues.description: Users are encountering "An error occurred in the authentication flow" on new Pieces installations.  This occurs on Windows and MacOS during initial sign-in.  Changing browsers, reinstalling, and checking firewall settings have not resolved the issue.  Logs indicate a potential websocket connection failure with Pieces Core Services (HTTP 404).

related_issues.title: An error occurred in the authentication flow.
related_issues.text:
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

12.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hello,
I am receiving this message when attempting to sign-in to Pieces.

```
An error occurred in the authentication flow.
Authentication Error ID: 00000000000000000000000000000000
```

This is a new install. (.appinstaller files)
I have never used the software before.
I do not have a pieces account (yet).
Environment: Windows 11

Launched the authentication by clicking the Sign In button in the Desktop App (4.2.1)
The auth link opened Firefox and generated the error.

I tried the following:
Disabling all extensions in Firefox
Changing my default browser to Edge and re-launching using Edge.
Re-installing with the .exe files.
Reviewed the windows firewall config (Pieces added it itself)
Looked at the Pieces log file but did not see anything obvious enough that I could solve on my own. (See attached)

[log-06252025-copy.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/20907036/log-06252025-copy.txt)

Thank you for the help.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Core Services Fails to Open Due to WebSocket Error
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported a WebSocketException with a 404 HTTP status code when attempting to open Pieces Core Services. The connection to 'http://127.0.0.1:39300/user/last_checked_in/stream#' fails to upgrade to a WebSocket.  This issue occurs across different operating systems (MacOS, Windows) and Pieces OS IDs.  Further investigation into the server-side WebSocket configuration and potential network connectivity issues is required.

common_issues.title: Pieces Core Services Fails to Open Due to WebSocket Error
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported a WebSocketException with a 404 HTTP status code when attempting to open Pieces Core Services. The connection to 'http://127.0.0.1:39300/user/last_checked_in/stream#' fails to upgrade to a websocket.  The issue appears on both macOS and Windows.  Further investigation into the server-side websocket configuration and Pieces Core Services installation is needed.

Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "Unable to open Pieces Core Services" issue, given its high frequency and impact on users. Investigate the root cause of the WebSocketException and 404 error.
Address the Pieces macOS app and Raycast extension update issues.  Ensure a smooth update process and compatibility with the latest Raycast version.
Investigate the authentication flow error ("An error occurred in the authentication flow") impacting new installations on Windows and macOS. Review logs and server-side authentication processes.
Improve communication with users experiencing update issues and authentication errors. Provide clear troubleshooting steps or workarounds.
Monitor the workstream activity update issue and determine if it's related to the broader update problems.
